channel.title: Leetcodes on Lroolle
channel.description: Recent content in Leetcodes on Lroolle

item.title: 0041. First Missing Positive
item.description: Problem Hard U:3696 D:813 Given an unsorted integer array, find the smallest missing positive integer. Example 1: Input: [1,2,0] Output: 3 Example 2: Input: [3,4,-1,1] Output: 2 Example 3: Input: [7,8,9,11,12] Output: 1 Follow up: NOTE: Your algorithm should run in O(n) time and uses constant extra space. Problem Insights At first, we may came up with an idea to sort the array, then loop through to find the missing positive.

item.title: 632. Smallest Range Covering Elements from K Lists
item.description: Problem Tags:Hard: D: 1076 U:25 You have k lists of sorted integers in ascending order. Find the smallest range that includes at least one number from each of the k lists. We define the range [a,b] is smaller than range [c,d] if b-a < d-c or a < c if b-a == d-c. Example 1: Input: [[4,10,15,24,26], [0,9,12,20], [5,18,22,30]] Output: [20,24] Explanation: List 1: [4, 10, 15, 24,26], 24 is in range [20,24].
